t: I*p lifted up mine eyes again, and looked, and behold a man with a measuring line in his hand.
Then*p said I, Whither goest thou? And he said unto me, To measure Jerusalem, to see what is the breadth thereof, and what is the length thereof.
And,*p behold, the angel that talked with me went forth, and another angel went out to meet him,
And*p said unto him, Run, speak to this young man, saying, Jerusalem shall be inhabited as towns without walls for the multitude of men and cattle therein:
For*p I, saith the Lord,*s will be unto her a wall of fire round about, and will be the glory in the midst of her.
Ho,*p ho, come forth, and flee from the land of the north, saith the Lord:*s for I have spread you abroad as the four winds of the heaven, saith the Lord.*s
Deliver*p thyself, O Zion, that dwellest with the daughter of Babylon.
For*p thus saith the Lord*s of hosts; After the glory hath he sent me unto the nations which spoiled you: for he that toucheth you toucheth the apple of his eye.
For,*p behold, I will shake mine hand upon them, and they shall be a spoil to their servants: and ye shall know that the Lord*s of hosts hath sent me.
Sing*p and rejoice, O daughter of Zion: for, lo, I come, and I will dwell in the midst of thee, saith the Lord.*s
And*p many nations shall be joined to the Lord*s in that day, and shall be my people: and I will dwell in the midst of thee, and thou shalt know that the Lord*s of hosts hath sent me unto thee.
And*p the Lord*s shall inherit Judah his portion in the holy land, and shall choose Jerusalem again.
Be*p silent, O all flesh, before the Lord:*s for he is raised up out of his holy habitation.
